body: Is this still happening? I don't see it when using the newest version of the gRPC library with that exact version of Ruby.

Yes, I no longer see this in IRB but I do still see this while running tests:

```
$ ruby -e "require 'grpc'; puts GRPC::VERSION"
0.13.0
$ irb

=> true
irb(main):002:0> exit

Also, we are able to make ruby segfault unless grpc is one of the first libraries required. We had to add the require to our test helper to avoid this. I have been hoping to create a much cleaner reproduction, but I haven't been able to yet. Would you like me to open a separate issue for that?
OK, #6266 (incidentally) changed intra-package `require` statements to `require_relative`, and I think that should eliminate this warning completely. @blowmage Can you verify?

We no longer see the circular warning using version 0.13.1 in IRB or our tests.

```
$ ruby -e "require 'grpc'; puts GRPC::VERSION"
0.13.1
$ irb
irb(main):001:0> require "grpc"
=> true
